climbs.name: Project ( We call it titty twister)

content.description: Start on left side pull and move to largest piton and move up right to nipple get a twist in a move on up.

Same start as A.B.C. goes right to really positive iron deposit and goes up from there using left hand side pulls, as stab to the pinch from breakaway (using it the opposite way) and a thrutch for the top.  

youtube.com/watch?v=TedI-rQâ€¦

  video of the F.A. for a better idea.
content.protection: couple pads that continually slip down the hill.

content.description: Starts seated on the right arete. While staying on the main face, pull up and left to a fossilized prune knob, followed by a small sidepull just next to the arete, then direct to the top using a left pinch and foot work. A slightly easier variation uses the right arete and round the corner holds at V2-3.
content.location: Hike to the top of the ridge 50ft past Hang loose. You should be standing at the end of a small clearing. With your back to the road and in line with the barrel ridge area turn 90 degrees to the left (East). Staying below the faint ridge on the right walk approx. 100ft into the woods, cross a rocky drainage ditch, and the boulder should be right in front of you. Its about a 5min walk if you know where your going. Right side of the Vadge Boulder.

content.description: Hard sit start on the left side of the boulder. Tough gastons to start, then into hug and heeling moves. End with many different variations...big pocket out left...continued gastons... or by slapping the crack out right. Choose your own adventure.
content.location: Hike to the top of the ridge 50ft past Hang loose. You should be standing at the end of a small clearing.  Turn 90 degrees to the left (East). Staying below the ridge walk approx. 100ft into the woods, cross a rocky drainage ditch, and the boulder should be right in front of you. Its about a 5min walk if you know where your going. Left side of Vadge Boulder.

content.description: A cool bus-sized boulder with a 45 degree overhanging face that holds a few great lines.
